feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Event Mesh
feed.subtitle: SAP Event Mesh Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Conditionally send a standard event from SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Cloud to BTP Event Mesh
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am exploring the event mesh functionality on BTP Cloud Integration Suite. My scenarios is when a sales order item delivery date is changed, I need to send an event to BTP Event Mesh. I know standard event topic 'sap/s4/beh/salesorder/v1/SalesOrder/ItemChanged/v1' is available but it is sent for any change on sales order item. I think this cannot be achieved with mere filtering by any properties.

Is there any way I can influence the event publish from SAP S/4HANA Cloud to send only in case of change to delivery date if sales order item?

If not, the event consumer has to call s/4hana cloud api to get the sales order detail. In this case how can we know that delivery date has changed and not any other fields?

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Duplicate run of integration flow consuming event from event mesh
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a doubt related to event message consumption in SAP Cloud Integration. I am consuming an event topic configured in Event Mesh capability within SAP Integration Suite.

And created a topic subscription in the above queue. This event is sent from S/4HANA Cloud system when a sales order item is changed.

 

I am consuming the event in Cloud Integration process using AMQP sender adapter

 

 

Now when a sales order item is changed in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, I see the iFlow is triggered successfully but there always are two runs in the log:

Also the queue in event mesh is not cleared even after successful completion of the message in cloud integration process consuming the event.

1. Why is it triggering two runs of the same consumer integration process?

2. Why is the queue not getting cleared after integration flow completes.

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Duplicate run of integration flow consuming event from event mesh of SAP Cloud Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a doubt related to event message consumption in SAP Cloud Integration. I am consuming an event topic configured in Event Mesh capability within SAP Integration Suite.

 

And created a topic subscription in the above queue. This event is sent from S/4HANA Cloud system when a sales order item is changed.

 

 

I am consuming the event in Cloud Integration process using AMQP sender adapter

 

 

 

 

Now when a sales order item is changed in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, I see the iFlow is triggered successfully but there always are two runs in the log:

 

Also the queue in event mesh is not cleared even after successful completion of the message in cloud integration process consuming the event.

 

1. Why is it triggering two runs of the same consumer integration process?

2. Why is the queue not getting cleared after integration flow completes.

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: Event Mesh v.s. Cloud Integration - JMS Adapter
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

 

My understanding: To achieve asynchronous system integration, Event Mesh is often used. However, according to a blog, asynchronous integration can also be achieved without Event Mesh by using the JMS Adapter within Cloud Integration.

Questions:

  1. Is my understanding correct?
  2. If my understanding is correct, what are the advantages and disadvantages of using Event Mesh versus Cloud Integration - JMS Adapter?
  3. Are there specific use cases for Event Mesh versus Cloud Integration - JMS Adapter? Explanations with examples are appreciated. (when to use event mesh, and when to use JMS Adapter?)
  4. When subscribing Services in BTP Cockpit, Event Mesh must be registered separately from Integration Suite. Does this mean the costs are calculated separately?

Thank you.

entry.title: How to send an event with SAP NetWeaver Add-On for Event enablement 1.0?
entry.content:
I followed the configuration steps of the SAP NetWeaver Add-On for Event enablement 1.0, as described here:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP%20NetWeaver%20Add-On%20for%20Event%20enablement%201.0/e966e6c0e61443ebaa0270a4bae4b363/53d14e7af03f436a8dbf6072928ed4bf.html

I tried to send a notification event for Sales Order Change Event, as described here:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blogs-by-members/sap-enterprise-messaging-for-sap-erp-howto-guide-part-2-first-use-case/ba-p/13463694

Unfortunately, it does not work, even though I have done all the steps correctly (I suppose). Checking transactions /ASADEV/ACI_MONITOR or to SLG1 does not show me anything (also no errors). My questions is: What can I do now, to identify the problem? I checked all steps steps, in case I missed something and now I am unsure how my further error analysis shall look like. Would be great if someone can provide some help.

entry.title: Publishing to a Queue or Topic in BTP Event Mesh using Postman
entry.content:
Dear Professional.

Currently, I am creating and setting up BTP's Event Mesh Instance (only messagingrest method is activated) and testing in Cockpit, all (Publish - Queue/Topic, Cosume) are processed normally, but an error occurs when requesting Publish (Queue and Topic) in Postman.

When testing Publish (Queue) in Postman, a 403 Error occurs. I don't know what the problem is.

The URI called is as follows.
https://<http rest address>/messagingrest/v1/queues/sap%2Fdemo%2Fai/messages

Thank you.

entry.title: SAP RAP Events local Consumption
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am seeing a weird issue with local event consumption of standard RAP events. So, I have seen if we create Purchase order from ME21N SAP GUI, standard RAP BO event Created of R_PurchaseOrderTP is triggered. Once, I implemented the local handler for this entity event, it doesn't trigger immediately. But once I go inside debugging mode, it starts triggering. 

 

Have anyone else faced this issue? Do we have to activate or run any program for this?

entry.title: Enterprise Event Enablement - Creating custom event using RAP in S/4 OP
entry.content:
I am trying to capture events triggered on PM Maintenance Order and send them to SAP Event Mesh using the standard Enterprise Event Enablement framework on S/4HANA. It works for create and phase changes like 'In Planning', 'Released' and 'Complete'. However, it does not work for classic 'Change'.  In the standard BO: BUS2007 - Maintenance Order, there is no standard event topic for change of data, meaning, S/4 does not trigger events when something changes in the Maintenance Order. For example, I would like S/4 to fire an event when there is a change in the 'Basic Start Date' of the Maintenance Order. However, there is no standard event topic for 'change'. These are the below events available but they do not trigger when something changes in the Order. 

I have checked the RAP behavior definition for this BO : R_MAINTENANCEORDERTP and also in the list of events in the BOR for the BO: BUS2007, there is no appropriate event defined for change of data.

Is there a way in S/4 that I can extend the standard functionality to trigger an event when something changes on this BO? I want to bind this event to the standard Enterprise Event Enablement framework to send it to SAP Event Mesh. I have gone through a lot of documentation on RAP extensibility of business events but I am unable to wire them together because of my lack of experience in RAP development. 

Can someone show pointers on how this can be achieved?

#SAPEventMesh #SAPEnterpriseEventEnablement SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Syntax Error in Behavior Implementation Class for R_MATERIALDOCUMENTTP in SAP S/4HANA 2022
entry.content:
I hope this message finds you well.

As part of our ongoing project to enhance the Material Document functionality, we are developing a custom event binding to incorporate specific filters and additional attributes tailored to our business requirements. Our approach thus far includes:

  1. Creation of Root Entity: Establishing the foundational entity for the Material Document.

  2. Development of Abstract Entity: Defining the abstract structure to support our custom logic.

  3. Implementation of Custom Behavior Class: Designing the behavior class to encapsulate the business logic.

  4. Service Binding: Integrating the behavior class with the service layer for seamless communication.

However, we have encountered a syntax error as (BEHAVIOR " was expected, not "EVENTS") during the activation of the behavior implementation class for the R_MATERIALDOCUMENTTP entity. Notably, the same syntax functions correctly in SAP S/4HANA 2023, but fails in the 2022 version

Upon investigation, we understand that SAP S/4HANA 2022 enforces a restricted ABAP environment, which imposes limitations on certain ABAP syntax and constructs. This environment restricts the use of dynamic programming constructs, code generation techniques, and access to non-released SAP APIs, among other constraints.

Thanks,

Prathip

entry.title: AEM integration with S/4HANA On-Premise 2022 Initial Stack
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community!

I'm currently working on a migration from traditional Event Mesh to ADVANCED Event Mesh for an S/4HANA On-Premise 2022 Initial Stack implementation. The goal is to enable Enterprise Event functionality in this environment.

However, I‚Äôve encountered a challenge:
üîπ The official SAP Help Portal only provides instructions for S/4HANA 2022 LATEST, but I haven‚Äôt been able to find any documentation or support for the Initial Stack version.

üîπ It seems there is no direct guidance on whether Enterprise Event support exists for S/4HANA 2022 Initial Stack, or if there‚Äôs an alternative approach to achieve this migration.

Has anyone successfully enabled Enterprise Event on S/4HANA On-Premise 2022 Initial Stack using Advanced Event Mesh?

üí° Any recommendations, workarounds, or insights would be greatly appreciated!
Looking forward to your suggestions!

Thanks in advance.

 

References: 

2022 - Initial: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/810dfd34f2cc4f39aa8d946b5204fd9c/fbfdeeab605349b7b1f0330ee4af253b.html?version=2022.000&locale=en-US

2022 - Latest: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/810dfd34f2cc4f39aa8d946b5204fd9c/a1d2475783c84ffca5f1ad308713dc82.html?version=2022.latest&locale=en-US

entry.title: Is it possible make a CAP Application consume events from EMIS (Integration Suite Event Mesh) ?
entry.content:
Hi CAP community.

I am trying to leverage EMIS (Integration Suite's Event Mesh capability) within a CAP v9 Application. I am following this great video of @ajmaradiaga along side with CAP's documentation (which is not specific to EMIS, but to Standalone Event Mesh service). 

I have successfully set up a queue + topic subscription in EMIS which is receiving events from S/4HANA Public Cloud. I created a service instance of SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh (message-client plan) to provide the credentials to the CAP application (and S4), and bound it both in .cdsrc and mta to feed them at runtime. This is working.

So far so good,  but here is the twist: the bound credentials of the EMIS service don't contain the 'management' object that CAP's messaging service implementation is expecting. See the below error, which is what I am hitting after starting the cap server using

"kind": enterprise-messaging  (or -shared)

options.credentials is correctly bound to EMIS client service key, but no management object exist

I know that when you create an instance of the Standalone SAP Event Mesh service, the keys contain this management object, as stated in the 'documentation'. However, the binding to the EMIS Message Client doesn't:

This makes me wonder: is CAP prepared to integrate with Integration Suite's Event Mesh, or not yet? (CAP documentation doesn't mention this specific use case).

Is there something wrong within my set up?

 

Any help or clue is well appreciated!

Lucho

entry.title: Filtering in Advanced Event Mesh from IDOC
entry.content:
Hi All,

The client is on ECC and they are using CPI to connect to a 3rd party system via BTP Advanced Event Mesh(AEM).

CPI gets an IDoc from SAP ECC and they route it via AEM Topic which needs to be filtered out in AEM based on a customer account group 0002 & 0003.

How do we set this filter at the AEM topic/subscription level instead of setting up in CPI.

Thanks

entry.title: Events are consolidated and received in CI via 1 MPL ID
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have used Event Mesh broker to consume events from S/4HANA and process them to CI via AMQP adapter. For this particular scenario, the EM queue is subscribed with below events

/sap/s4/beh/billofmaterial/v1/BillOfMaterial/ItemChanged/v1
/sap/s4/beh/billofmaterial/v1/BillOfMaterial/ItemCreated/v1

Whenever the Header Material that corresponds to BillOfMaterial is updated, multiple events are triggered for all the BillOfMaterialComponent associated with that header material and the events are consolidated and sent as 1 message in CPI with 1 MPL id.

Is this expected behavior? Kindly advise.

 

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Event Mesh activation not possible in Integration Suite - free plan
entry.content:
Hello!

I am trying to set up the Manage Business Events Capability in Integration Suite - free plan

I am able to activate the capability, but when trying to activate Event Mesh (Configure -> Event Mesh) I get a message that it was set up ok but the Event Mesh shows the "failed" sign. In the queues it shows "Event mesh activation failed. Please try again."

I found note 0003527095 which references this error, but the suggested solution "To resolve this issue, the Event Mesh default plan must be removed from the subaccount." does not apply here, I have not added the Event Mesh default plan to the sub-account and still get the error.

I am wondering if the Event Mesh can even be used from the Integration Suite - free plan (I am using a PAYG global account with only the Integration Suite - free added for the subaccount).

Any help would be greatly appreciated, thanks!

entry.title: EDA with AEM and SAP Customer Activity Repository
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

we‚Äôre currently expanding our Event-Driven Architecture using SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM) to connect more systems and data products.

Most integrations follow a standardized approach, which helps us keep things maintainable. One system we‚Äôre now looking at is SAP Customer Activity Repository (CAR) ‚Äì especially for event-based use cases like promotions and coupons.

We‚Äôve explored several options, but none of them seem to fit well into a clean, standard setup:

  • AIF for AEM doesn‚Äôt run on CAR due to missing S/4HANA core components.
  • ASAPIO isn‚Äôt supported on CAR.
  • SLT from CAR to S/4HANA to use AIF or ASAPIO there feels like a detour.
  • Custom BAPI-based REST calls are possible, but not really what we‚Äôre aiming for.

So here‚Äôs the question:

Is there a standard or recommended way to bring SAP CAR into an event-driven architecture‚Äîwithout relying on custom developments or indirect replication paths?

Would love to hear how others have approached this!
